DOC.detailed_description: Fifty patient age 18 - 65 year , American Society Anesthesiologists ( ASA ) I-II-III , schedule laparoscopic cholecystectomy enrol study . Patients allocate two group receive ultrasound guided subcostal transversus abdominis plane block ( group T , n=25 ) ultrasound guide paravertebral block ( group P , n=25 ) . In patient ; anesthesia induce iv propofol ( 2 mg.kg-1 ) maintain total intravenous anesthesia ( TIVA ) mixture 50 % nitrous oxide 50 % oxygen total gas flow rate 4 L min-1 . Neuromuscular relaxation induce iv rocuronium ( 0.5 mg.kg-1 ) . Propofol ( 2 mg / cc , 2-4 mg / kg / h ) remifentanil ( 13.3 mcg / cc , 1-3 mcg / kg / h ) combination use TIVA . Propofol remifentanil rate increase reduced accord patient 's hemodynamic response . Prior start surgery , ultrasound guide subcostal transversus abdominis plane paravertebral block perform patient . Blood pressure , heart rate peripheral oxygen saturation , TIVA consumption 0 , 5 , 10 , 15 , 30 , 60 min record patients.Before end surgery , tramadol administer ( 2 mg / kg ) patient . All patient evaluate postoperative 2th , 4th , 8th , 12th , 24th hour ; operation time , heart rate , blood pressure , peripheral oxygen saturation , visual pain score ( VAS ) , analgesic consumption , complication ( hypotension , anaphylaxis , hematoma , IV injection , intra-abdominal organ injury , pneumothorax ) patient satisfaction status record .
